reviews.review:
The critics have once again proven that they have no idea what makes a good Star Wars movie. They complain about the "unnecessary course correction" from the most hated movie of the entire franchise and bemoan a "lack of imagination" in a movie which shows more creativity than the previous two movies combined.

Rise of Skywalker is the movie that the fans wanted and deserved. Where Johnson seemingly tried to kill the franchise with his abomination of a film, Abrams has saved it. The story concludes in a dramatic, exciting, and satisfying manner with this film.

Overall, in terms of overall quality, Rise of Skywalker sits somewhere between Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi. It irritates critics seemingly by placing good storytelling at the top of the list of its priorities, above the unwanted social commentary we got with Last Jedi.

If there is one complaint I have with this film it's that the scenes with Leia feel completely wrong. Almost like the other actors in the scene are acting against footage shot for an entirely different movie with an actress who isn't there (imagine that). Seriously though, they did a somewhat less than stellar job inserting the late Carrie Fisher into this film. I realize they had to work with what they had, but the end result was not great for those scenes.

In short: the critics panning this movie are idiots, which we already knew after they so heavily praised the train wreck that was Last Jedi.
I loved the action. I loved how they wove Carrie Fisher into the scenes. It was fast paced, visually stunning and wrapped up the story very well letting us know at last, Rays family
Effectively worked past, present and future together. A satisfying finale.
EPIC!  The storyline is full of unexpected events.  The imagery is breathtaking and the many ways this movie pays homage to the original characters and story line is impressive.
I actually hated Adam Driver as Kylo. He was not a convincing villian whatsoever. With that said, I loved the series overall. It was fun!
Looks like they crammed all the same stories from the past movies intro this movie.
Probably an unpopular opinion, but we found it pretty meh.
We loved the movie. It tied all of the different movies together. It was full of action.
I liked it, I think they wrapped it up perfectly.  I hope he doesn't make another one, The saga needs to be over.
This was a truly incredible movie! The surprises kept me guessing! I did not expect a surprise visit from a previous actor. Very refreshing and lots of action, as usual!
